Question 89) During rainy seasons, dengue prevention campaigns increase in Brazil, which aim to reduce the proliferation of the Aedes aegypti mosquito, transmitter of the dengue virus.
What preventive proposal could be effective to reduce the reproduction of this mosquito?
A) Placing screens on doors and windows, as the mosquito needs covered and closed environments for its reproduction.
B) Replacement of mud houses with masonry houses, since the mosquito reproduces on the wall of clay houses.
C) Removal of containers that may accumulate water, because the mosquito larvae develop in this environment.
D) Proper hygiene of foods, since mosquito larvae develop in this type of substrate.
E) placement of water filters in the houses, since the reproduction of the mosquito happens in contaminated waters.
